content: WordPerfect is a popular word processor that has been available since 1979. The WordPerfect Corporation released versions of WordPerfect for Data General minicomputers, MS-DOS, and Microsoft Windows. Corel acquired WordPerfect in 1996, the same year WordPerfect 7 was released.
By default, WordPerfect 7 saves users' documents as WP7 files. The WP7 format replaced the .WP6 format and was itself replaced by the .WPD format.

description: A WP7 file is a text document created by WordPerfect 7, a word processor available for Windows 95. It contains a memo, contract, form, or other type of document. These documents can consist of formatted text, tables, and images.

instructions: You can open a WP7 file with Corel WordPerfect (Windows). Current versions of WordPerfect still support the WP7 format. You can also open WP7 files with LibreOffice (multiplatform).
